body_html:
You need to install CUDA 7.5 rather than CUDA 8.0 which is not yet
supported by pre-built binaries

On Thu, Sep 29, 2016 at 4:58 PM, lxj0276 notifications@github.com wrote:

I'm a new user of tensorflow.I install tensorflow like this.
1.export TF_BINARY_URL=https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/
linux/gpu/tensorflow-0.10.0-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl
2.sudo pip install --upgrade $TF_BINARY_URL

and I succeed install tensorflow ,when I import tensorflow ,It happens
that "ImportError: libcudart.so.7.5: cannot open shared object file: No
such file or directory".It's crazy,I find some solution ,that my shell
environment variables should do like this:
1.export LD_LIBRARY_PATH="$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/usr/local/cuda/lib64"
2.export CUDA_HOME=/usr/local/cuda
but it not works.
I find there is not libcudart.so.7.5 in "/usr/local/cuda/lib64",it's only
"libcudart so.8.0"

os:ubuntu 16.04 LTS,cuda:8.0

—
You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
#4664, or mute the thread
https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AABaHP8DQIGixnv8CEimUzlK8nKPmOazks5qvFC9gaJpZM4KKmkP
.

body:
You need to install CUDA 7.5 rather than CUDA 8.0 which is not yet
supported by pre-built binaries

On Thu, Sep 29, 2016 at 4:58 PM, lxj0276 notifications@github.com wrote:

> I'm a new user of tensorflow.I install tensorflow like this.
> 1.export TF_BINARY_URL=https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/
> linux/gpu/tensorflow-0.10.0-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl
> 2.sudo pip install --upgrade $TF_BINARY_URL
> 
> and I succeed install tensorflow ,when I import tensorflow ,It happens
> that "ImportError: libcudart.so.7.5: cannot open shared object file: No
> such file or directory".It's crazy,I find some solution ,that my shell
> environment variables should do like this:

> 2.export CUDA_HOME=/usr/local/cuda
> but it not works.
> I find there is not libcudart.so.7.5 in "/usr/local/cuda/lib64",it's only
> "libcudart so.8.0"
> 
> os:ubuntu 16.04 LTS,cuda:8.0
